title: 200-Year Perspective Check
description: Perspective is easily gained by asking, 'In 200 years how will this matter?'
instructions: When stressed about something, ask 'In 200 years, how will this matter?' Let the answer guide your response.

title: Adaptability Practice
description: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change. - Stephen Hawking
instructions: When plans change unexpectedly, pause and ask 'How can I adapt?' Focus on solutions rather than resistance.

title: Artistic Diversion
description: Artistic diversion: create music, art, pottery, and other artistic activities. It uses the brain differently which translates to other aspects of life.
instructions: Spend 30 minutes on music, art, pottery, or other creative expression. Notice how it affects your thinking in other areas.

title: Bath
description: Relax and cleanse with a rejuvenating bath

title: Better Questions Practice
description: The greatest answers come from asking better questions.
instructions: Before solving any problem, spend 5 minutes crafting better questions. 'How can I...' instead of 'Why can't I...'

title: Breakfast
description: Start your day with a nutritious breakfast

title: Conflict Resolution
description: Resolve disputes with wisdom and skill

title: Creative Thinking
description: Generate innovative ideas and solutions

title: Deep Reflection
description: Contemplate life's deeper meanings

title: Dogs
description: Spend quality time with your canine companions

title: Edison Strategic Napping
description: Strategic napping - using the Edison technique.
instructions: Hold a small object while taking a 10-20 minute nap. When it drops and wakes you, immediately capture any insights.

title: Ego Check Before Speaking
description: Before speaking, determine what you hope to accomplish. If it is your ego speaking, stop.
instructions: Before speaking, ask 'What am I trying to accomplish?' If it's ego-driven (proving superiority), choose silence.

title: Ego or Joy Choice
description: You can be right or you can be happy. Choose. Ego or Joy.
instructions: When you feel the need to prove you're right, pause and ask 'Do I want to be right or happy?' Choose joy.

title: Empathy Practice
description: Understand others' perspectives deeply

title: Extreme Imagination Practice
description: You must allow your mind to go to take you to extreme heights, alternative views, and even crazy imaginations. Then when you come back to earth, you are likely to land on the top of a mountain.
instructions: Spend 10 minutes imagining the most extreme, crazy solutions to a problem. Return to earth and find the mountaintop insights.

title: Failure Alchemy
description: When you fail once, if you learn and solve it, you will never fail twice.
instructions: When you fail, immediately ask 'What did I learn?' and 'How will I solve this differently next time?' Document the lesson.

title: Focus on Wants
description: Focus on what you DO want, not what you DON'T want.
instructions: When planning or problem-solving, ask 'What do I want to happen?' instead of 'What don't I want?' Focus energy positively.

title: Focused Meditation Practice
description: Meditations is not thinking of nothing. It is the act of watching you mind think of one thing. And when that one thing is a deity, then miracles can happen. And when that one thing is your true self, time stops.
instructions: Choose one focus (breath, deity, or true self). When mind wanders, gently return. Notice the magic of one-pointed focus.

title: Gratitude Practice
description: Acknowledge what you are thankful for

title: Guided Meditation Course
description: Course: Guided meditations (breath, creative, meeting, blessing, question)
instructions: Practice guided meditations for breath, creativity, meetings, blessings, and question-seeking. 5 sessions total.

title: Hydrate
description: Stay hydrated with pure water

title: Imagination Over Knowledge
description: Einstein: 'Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution.' (My thought: knowledge defines what we know. Imagination defines what we will know.)
instructions: Spend 15 minutes imagining impossible solutions to current challenges. Let imagination guide you to new possibilities.

title: Imagineering Practice
description: Imagineering. Spend time imagining a great idea, a perfect positive solution, or a creative alternative path. Give you mind permission to enjoy a playground of no rules, only possibilities and magic!
instructions: Give yourself 15 minutes to imagine a perfect solution with no rules or constraints. Enjoy the playground of pure possibility.

title: Innovation Session
description: Create breakthrough solutions

title: Inspire Others
description: Motivate people to achieve greatness

title: Leadership Moment
description: Lead others toward a common goal

title: Learning by Doing
description: The fastest way to learn is by doing. Copy someone who knows and you get the same results without knowing. But by doing, you will come to know too.
instructions: Find someone skilled in what you want to learn. Copy their exact methods first, then adapt as you gain experience.

title: Life-Changing Decision
description: Make a decision that transforms your path

title: Master New Skill
description: Achieve mastery in a meaningful domain

title: Mentoring Others
description: Guide and teach someone valuable skills

title: Mindful Breathing
description: Center yourself with conscious breathing

title: Pain and Joy Sharing
description: Be a true friend: sharing their pain cuts it in half, sharing their joy doubles it.
instructions: When friends share struggles, offer presence. When they share wins, celebrate genuinely. Double their joy, halve their pain.

title: Permission First Protocol
description: Always get permission first, then coach or advise.
instructions: Before offering advice, ask 'Would you like some input on this?' or 'Are you looking for advice or just venting?'

title: Posture Check
description: Align your spine and shoulders

title: Priority Filtering
description: Identify 10 projects. Then get rid of 7 of them. Focus on what matters most.
instructions: List 10 current projects or priorities. Cross out 7. Focus only on the remaining 3 for the next month.

title: Problem Solving
description: Tackle complex challenges systematically

title: Process Success Definition
description: Define Success by your process, not your outcome. The act of writing in your journal is what matters, not what you write. Some days will be enjoyable. Some days may be a struggle. But the ACT of writing in your journal is success. Same with everything. Just showing up is 90% of success.
instructions: Choose one important habit. Success = doing it, regardless of results. Journal about process wins daily.

title: Pure Listening Practice
description: Listen. No agenda, no ego. Just listen. Action: repeat their comments or summarize what they said so they feel heard.
instructions: Give someone 5 minutes of complete attention. No advice, no solutions. Repeat back what you heard so they feel truly heard.

title: Questions Over Statements
description: When tension rises or conflict appears, immediately switch from making statements to asking questions.
instructions: When you feel conflict building, stop making statements. Ask 'Help me understand...' or 'What would work better?'

title: Quick Walk
description: Get your body moving with a short walk

title: Read
description: Expand your knowledge through reading

title: Reflect
description: Take time for personal reflection and introspection

title: Self-Change Focus
description: Most conflicts in relationships arise from trying to change another. The truth is you can only change yourself.
instructions: When frustrated with someone, ask 'What can I change about my response?' Focus energy on your own growth.

title: Self-Kindness Practice
description: Be kind. Mostly to yourself.
instructions: Throughout the day, notice your self-talk. Replace harsh criticism with kind, encouraging words.

title: Self-Talk Coaching
description: Self Talk. Be the coach you have always wanted.
instructions: Replace negative self-talk with encouraging coaching language. Ask 'What would my ideal coach say right now?'

title: Simplification Practice
description: A bumbling fool can create a complicated idea. It takes genius to simplify it.
instructions: Take one complex idea you're working with. Spend 10 minutes simplifying it until a child could understand it.

title: Skill Practice
description: Develop a meaningful skill or craft

title: Strategic Planning
description: Plan your approach to important goals

title: Strategic Silence
description: One of the most powerful tools in communication is silence.
instructions: After speaking, count to 5 before responding. Let others fill the silence. Notice how it changes the conversation.

title: Thoughts vs Intuition Practice
description: Thoughts are man talking to the Universe. Intuition is the Universe talking to man.
instructions: Spend 5 minutes distinguishing: 'This is me talking to the universe' vs 'This is the universe talking to me.'

title: Transformative Reading
description: Throughout history, the most proven way to change (yourself or the world) is to read new thoughts. You learn and get inspired. It is the step before thought as you ride on the brilliant thoughts of others. Then you can have your own.
instructions: Spend 20-30 minutes daily reading books or articles that challenge your current thinking. Take notes on insights.

title: Truth First Protocol
description: Live Truth First Protocol - every word, every deed, based on truth. Not ego.
instructions: Before speaking or acting, pause and ask 'Is this truth or ego speaking?' Choose truth even when harder.

title: Vulnerable Authenticity
description: Be vulnerable and authentic. With consideration and sensitivity, when others are struggling, share your similar experiences and how you overcame... or even how you still struggle.
instructions: When others face challenges similar to yours, share your experience (struggles and growth) with sensitivity and care.

title: Walking Meeting Meditation
description: Walking meetings meditation
instructions: Take a 20-minute walk while contemplating a creative challenge. No phone, no distractions. Let insights emerge naturally.

title: Wise Silence Practice
description: Those who speak, don't know. Those who know, don't speak.
instructions: Before sharing knowledge or opinions, ask 'Am I speaking from wisdom or ego?' Choose silence when appropriate.

title: Writing for Answers
description: When you want an answer, start writing. Start by writing your question. Then say, 'If I did know the answer, what would I write...' and just start writing. Imagine and pretend you know and after 10 minutes of writing, you will begin to.
instructions: Write your question, then write 'If I did know the answer...' and keep writing for 10 minutes. Trust what emerges.
